intro: Zeuxine purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-flowered zeuxine, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking purple or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive lobed shape. Zeuxine purpurascens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
